title: Living to Please God
shortSummary: In 1 Thessalonians 4, Paul exhorts believers to live holy lives pleasing to God, emphasizing sanctification and brotherly love. The chapter also provides comforting teaching about the resurrection of the dead and the return of Christ, encouraging believers to live with hope and holiness.
timeline: c. AD 50-51 - Paul's First Epistle to the Thessalonians during his second missionary journey

keyCharacters.name: Paul
keyCharacters.description: The apostle and author of the letter who instructs the Thessalonian believers on holy living and the return of Christ.

keyCharacters.name: Thessalonian Believers
keyCharacters.description: The recipients of Paul's letter, a young church being taught how to live in sanctification and hope.

definitions.definition: The process of being made holy and set apart for God’s purposes, involving moral purity and spiritual growth.
Sexual immorality or unlawful sexual relations outside the covenant of marriage.
Christian love and affection among believers, characterized by care, kindness, and unity.
Believers who have died trusting in Jesus Christ and will be resurrected at His coming.

outline.heading: Exhortation to Holy Living
outline.description: Paul urges the Thessalonians to continue walking in a way that pleases God, focusing on sanctification and abstaining from sexual immorality, emphasizing that God calls believers to holiness, not uncleanness.

outline.heading: Brotherly Love and Responsible Living
outline.description: Paul commends their love for one another and encourages them to grow in it, while also instructing them to live quietly, mind their own affairs, and work diligently to maintain a good testimony before outsiders.

outline.heading: Comfort Regarding the Dead in Christ
outline.description: Paul addresses concerns about believers who have died, assuring the Thessalonians of the resurrection at Christ’s return and encouraging them to comfort one another with this hope.

application: Pursue holiness by abstaining from sexual immorality and honoring God with your body.
Cultivate brotherly love by actively caring for fellow believers and seeking to grow in love continually.
Live responsibly and diligently by working honestly and maintaining a peaceful, quiet life.
Find comfort and hope in the promise of Christ’s return and the resurrection of believers who have died.

keyVerses.text: For this is the will of God, even your sanctification, that ye should abstain from fornication:
keyVerses.significance: This verse clearly states God's will for believers to live holy lives, emphasizing sanctification and purity.

keyVerses.text: For God hath not called us unto uncleanness, but unto holiness.
keyVerses.significance: It underscores the divine calling for believers to live holy lives, separating them from sin.

keyVerses.text: For the Lord himself shall descend from heaven with a shout, with the voice of the archangel, and with the trump of God: and the dead in Christ shall rise first:
keyVerses.significance: This verse provides a vivid description of Christ’s return and the resurrection, offering hope and assurance of eternal life.

keyVerses.text: Wherefore comfort one another with these words.
keyVerses.significance: Paul encourages believers to use the hope of Christ’s coming to encourage and strengthen one another.
